summary: Any marriageable NPC will become a follower after the wedding. (Hearthfires required.)
descriptionHtml:
This is my second mod I'm uploading to the Nexus. I hope you enjoy!
[color=#ff0000][b][color=#ff7700]Please note this mod requires Hearthfires!
[color=#ff0000]Please read the section "Warnings and Precautions" before using![/color][/color][/b][/color]

[color=#ffff00][b][u][size=4]Description[/size]

[/u][/b][size=3][color=#ffffff][size=2]After marrying an NPC in-game, I found it kind of lame and heartbreaking that you have basically sentenced them to life in whichever home you send them. I know there are mods out there that allow for your spouse to actually work a store stall outside the home during the day, and at least one I can think of that allows them sandbox about town, but that still seems... lacking.

I want to be able to take my spouse with me on my travels. Maybe take them for a walk around a lake, introduce them to other friends, let them see the world. And most importantly, let them share in your life as [i]the Dovahkiin.[/i] Have them witness when you take down powerful enemies, when you save someone's life, let them be an actual companion to help you save Skyrim!

With all this in mind, I have made this simple mod that turns any NPC into your follower [u]during[/u] the wedding ceremony; After the ceremony they will have all the follower options.Â  All I did was add one line of code to the wedding scene script. [i]This mod does not work retro-actively; If you're already married it will do nothing.[/i]

[u][b][color=#ffff00][size=4][size=3][size=4]Installation[/size]
[/size][/size][/color][/b][/u][color=#ffff00][size=4][size=3][color=#ffffff][size=2]
Back-up your save!
Install using the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/57044/?]Mod Manager
[/url][/size][/color]
[/size][/size][/color][/size][/color][/size][/color]OR For manual install:

1) Unzip/Extract "SpouseBecomesFollower-(numbers).7z"
2) Select "SpouseBecomesFollower.esp" AND the "Scripts" folder.
3) Drag and drop/cut and paste into your "Skyrim\Data" folder.
4) Agree to merge folders.
5) Activate the ESP on your Plugins list.

[b]When To Install:

[/b]If it's not obvious, you should install this mod before you are married. Any stage of the Quest before walking into the Temple of Mara to begin the "wedding scene" should be fine. However, as is the case with -any- mod, I strongly suggest you install before starting a new game, with a "fresh" or "clean" save.

[size=4][b][u][color=#ffff00]Requirements
[/color][/u][/b][color=#ffff00][color=#ffffff]
[/color][/color][/size]This mod requires:
[u][b][color=#ff7700]Skyrim.esm
Updates.esm
Hearthfires.esm[/color][/b][/u]

[b][u][size=4][color=#ffff00]Compatibility[/color][/size][/u][/b]

This mod is [u]not [/u]compatible with any mods that alter the Quest

[color=#ffe599]RelationshipMarriageWedding[color=#ffffff] (Form ID: 0007404E)

This includes mods that changes or expands on the wedding ceremony itself. If requested, I will see what I can do about "patches" for other mods, but your best bet is to contact the author of the other mod; This one is very simplistic and easily integrated, and those authors will have a much better idea of how to handle it than I.

Although this was made with the Vanilla marriageable NPCs in mind, this mod -should- be compatible with any user-created NPC (as long as they can be married.) In most cases, user-created NPCs are already followers, so it's not an issue. But for the few that are not, there shouldn't be any problems.

[b][u][color=#ffff00][size=4]Uninstalling:[/size][/color][/u]

[/b]Uninstalling any mod that alters scripts during an active game/save is [b][i]never[/i][/b] a good idea. I highly recommend against it. However,

It can be removed:
Using the Mod Manager

OR, if you installed manually, deleting the following files:

SpouseBecomesFollower.esp (Located in "Skyrim\Data")
QF_RelationshipMarriageWeddin_0007404E.pex (Located in "Skyrim\Data\Scripts") ("Weddin" is not a typo.)
QF_RelationshipMarriageWeddin_0007404E.psc (Located in "Skyrim\Data\Scripts\Source")

(a note - you may have to replace "QF_RelationshipMarriageWeddin_0007404E.psc " with the one found inside the "Source" folder of "[u]Scripts.rar[/u]" under "Skyrim\Data". This shouldn't be necessary, but it -may- help if you have issues uninstalling.)

Again, I can't be sure what sort of things may happen if you uninstall during an active save. Papyrus is very touchy.
Uninstalling before a new game will not cause issues.

[color=#ff7700][size=4][b][u][center]Warnings and Precautions[/center][/u][/b][/size][/color][/color][/color]

[list=1]
[*][size=2]This is my first mod that involves any kind of scripting. While I have tested this mod under many circumstances, and I am confident in it's stability (otherwise why would I post it?) I can't say for certain what sort of bugs or hang-ups might arise. As you should do before installing any new mods, regardless, [u][i][b][color=#ff0000]BACK UP YOUR SAVES!![/color][/b][/i][/u] I have had this mod running in my game for many, [i]many[/i] play hours and have not come across any bugs. If you do, please report them to me and I will see what I can do to work around or fix the issue.[/size]
[*][color=#f9cb9c][size=2]Not All Marriageable NPCs Are Combat Ready or Essential! [/size][/color][size=2]This means that your spouse may very well die in combat if you're not careful. An easy way to get around this is to use the console command "setessential". Go [url=http://elderscrolls.wikia.com/wiki/Console_Commands_(Skyrim)]here[/url] for more information. You could also simply send them home before you go off on dangerous adventures.[/size]

[*][size=2]Some NPCs might not have "safe follower voices". [url=https://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/topic/964801-modder-reference-for-follower-voices/]Check out this thread for more information.[/url][/size]
[*] [size=2]Using the Creation Kit, you can make all kinds of tweaks to an NPC, such as Health, Fighting Style, Inventory, Confidence, Aggression, etc to make your spouse of choice a more viable combat partner, if you wish. Maybe you want them to be weak and afraid? It's your game. However, for more information on these tweaks [url=https://levelskip.com/rpgs/Hot-to-Turn-Your-Skyrim-Character-into-a-Follower]check out this guide[/url][/size][size=2] on making a custom follower/spouse as a guideline to editing an existing NPC.[/size]
[/list]
[u][b][color=#ffff00][size=4]Credits and Special Thanks[/size][/color][/b][/u]

I would like to thank the contributors to both the Creation Kit and Skyrim Wikis. Truly unsung heroes.
A big thank you to [i]j-u-i-c-e[/i] at LevelSkip for his article on creating a follower and marriage partner.

[b]Permissions: [/b]Anyone may make a translated version of this mod to upload to the Nexus. Authors of wedding scene mods may use/create a patch of the changes I have made, all I ask is a credit. Please do not post this mod to the Steam Community.
